title: Before 1 November 2021, will a new government mask mandate for individuals fully vaccinated for COVID-19 that includes indoor restaurants and/or retail establishments be imposed on New York City?
preds: New cases and hospitalization rates consistently trending lower.  https://www1.nyc.gov/site/doh/covid/covid-19-goals.page.
Wuhan plague is in decline... for now.
Passage of time. Cases are falling, hospitalizations are low, and the deaths remain incredibly low relative to the last year and a half.
Covid cases are declining, and there isn't one now.

Combination of remarkable turn in cases as well as - sadly - some evidence that masks are somewhat lower priority in terms of mitigating spread (with vaccinations especially being higher on the list). Given the nature of the question - quite limited in terms of venues - I think the odds might even be lower but am going to just glide down probability over course of month.
Still think this happens during the winter surge but unclear whether cases jump enough this month for it to happen
Bringing down significantly in acknowledgment of the rapid decline in hospitalization.

Three weeks since schools reopened and no signs of uncontrolled spread.  Again, this is a very aggressive position but the crowd keeps pushing consensus lower and I want to remain below consensus.  Source: https://covidactnow.org/us/metro/new-york-city-newark-jersey-city_ny-nj-pa/?s=23731285

No big change but reluctant to go down because Halloween is coming up and it is possible that someone in government would push retail shops and restaurants to wear masks, but it would take a mandate to flip this YES so it definitely isn't as easy as just preaching about it. So now the question of the matter is whether or not cases will get to the point where mandates are likely pushed. It seems at this time it is probably not.
Low probability of breakthrough cases in vaccinated individuals does not justify mandatory mask wearing
covid cases not dying off but only a month to go
As Deblasio stopped short on mask mandates before, betting he'll continue this policy by the deadline.
mark to market w. case counts falling

Looks like hospitalizations are decreasing for NYC area 14-day change -22, unless a new variant pops up probability is going down.
https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2021/us/new-york-city-new-york-covid-cases.html

Looks like 95%+ of people are following mask recommendations in retail establishments, restaurants. But as colder temps neqr and more people are indoors, also with holiday shopping, it might be mandated.

Not changing forecast on this, but worth noting. Next three weeks seem pretty critical. Does a combination of schools, broadway/tourists, UN result in a spike in cases?  https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-20/nyc-returns-to-hosting-un-week-as-new-yorkers-fear-covid-spike?srnd=premium&sref=i2Bc5OtW
Deceiving wording of the question. I basically bet no but leave a 10% space for the chance I'm wrong.
updating based on time passed, continuing decrease in the numbers in NYC, and what seems to be a continued reluctance for leaders to issue such a mandate.
A mandate will be imposed, the main question is 'when' rather than 'if'

Infection rate in New York City metro is below 1.00. Cases and positivity rate are falling. Vaccines rather than masks seems to be working. What might change? Schools are open as is Broadway. It's possible that either one causes another spike in two to three weeks. Also, a new variant that evades the vaccine would necessitate masks but very unlikely before November. Note to self: This is an aggressive position in part to stay below consensus forecast. Is it a mistake to allow consensus to influence my prediction in this way? Source:
https://covidactnow.org/us/metro/new-york-city-newark-jersey-city_ny-nj-pa/?s=22851206
Cases have been going down. I think the Delta wave will generally continue to decline through the forecast period, although cases might start to tip upward again in late October.

There is growing concern that the current downturn in cases is not the end of the delta wave in the Northeast: https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.cnbc.com/amp/2021/09/03/covid-cases-dr-scott-gottlieb-says-northeast-has-yet-to-see-true-delta-wave.html Estimates of r_0 in New York State have been revised and are no longer below 1: https://covidestim.org/us/NY Ultimately, though, cases and hospitalizations are falling and relatively low in NYC: https://www1.nyc.gov/site/doh/covid/covid-19-data-trends.page#epicurve And the question asks about a narrow subset of public places. Given the city’s strategic thrust towards vaccines, I’m maintaining forecast but on the lookout in case there is a spike post Labor Day or after schools re open.
Still a couple months to close, winter is coming, and new variants of concern are spreading through the US.
Cases are falling gradually, so I don't think they'll put any more strict measures in for this wave.

Historic rains and flooding....... probably don't feel like rolling out a new mask mandate at this very moment. It's become clear that this question is entirely about the prospect of resurgence of severe cases (i.e. do things get bad in october).

- cases may be leveling off/decreasing (https://www.google.com/search?q=coronavirus+statistics+new+york+city&ei=qoctYaHoNL3l5NoP7Z2c4AU&oq=coronavirus+statistics+new+york+ci&gs_lcp=Cgdnd3Mtd2l6EAMYADIFCAAQgAQyBggAEBYQHjIGCAAQFhAeMgUIABCGAzIFCAAQhgMyBQgAEIYDOgcIABBHELADOgcIABCwAxBDOgsIABCABBCxAxCDAUoECEEYAFD9sgJYqNECYJDbAmgCcAJ4AIABdYgB1QmSAQM5LjSYAQCgAQHIAQrAAQE&sclient=gws-wiz) - mask mandates are happening for schools throughout NY state (https://gothamist.com/news/hochul-orders-statewide-mask-mandate-inside-all-new-york-schools). This tells me there may be more support for schools rather than the general public. - Vaccine mandates are also happening (for schools: https://apnews.com/article/health-education-coronavirus-pandemic-676f2a2c63b4136360f8ea3682f48287 as well as for indoor dining/entertainment https://www1.nyc.gov/office-of-the-mayor/news/225-001/emergency-executive-order-225) - one week has past since my last forecast of 63% when the crowd was ~80%. The crowd seems to be coming down and I may have placed too little weight on the vaccine mandate for indoor dinning etc. De Blasio has stated he wants vaccines and won't do a mask mandate - however, it's still a wonder if the Governor Hochul will go beyond schools and issue a broader mandate. I think it's still very possible, but less than chance at this point. 45%
Cases have have dropped from a peak, but may not be 'the' peak. Will give politicians some confidence that they are right so far. Dropped forecast a bit to suit
Hospitalizations falling, following the trend in cases. Re affirming forecast.  https://www1.nyc.gov/site/doh/covid/covid-19-data-trends.page#epicurve
Adjusting up for ample time and rising hospitilizations, deaths, and increased projections from the models even though cases are falling. cc 30
cc; khn 15 transitions to 43 at time of writing
This is probably still too high, but oh well....

Case growth continues to slow and r_0 is down to 0.87. New York radio is pumping out the commercials about the vaccine - free, safe and effective. The strategy is clear and it's working. As my Dad used to say when playing tennis: "Don't change a winning game".  Only way a mandate comes out is if you get a resurgence in cases and, in particular, in severity/hospitalization. So I'm mainly not slamming the probability lower because of the time element on the question.  https://covidestim.org/us/NY

I am sticking with my 35% even though the crowd disagrees. I set my benchmarks to reconsider at 25 cases per 100k or 5% positivity rate. Neither level was hit and now cases, infection rate, and positivity rate are all flat to down in the New York metro area. [1] As I discovered on the restaurant capacity question, however, the politics might not follow the science. Does the politics suggest more caution or less caution than the science? I would argue that DeBlasio does not want to increase restrictions and that New Yorkers are not eager to go backwards.  Any one else want to weigh in on science vs politics? @cdob63, you follow New York politics. Are you forecasting this market? [1] https://covidactnow.org/us/metro/new-york-city-newark-jersey-city_ny-nj-pa/?s=22191145

Think I should be a little more conservative especially after reading @alexandemeister @probahilliby as well as looking at recent Rt trends there.  Glad I checked on this question. That being said, November 1st is a fair amount of time away and I still think other cities implementing mandates will set the precedent (especially should cases go back up).  IMO a NO answer here relies on delta having peaked as well as on the belief that high vaccination rates lower the necessity of masks (while currently breakthrough cases are becoming increasingly more likely as vaccines grow less effective with time and boosters wouldn't affect by Nov 1)

If this forecast is correct, my advice is to read the question carefully and look at the peaks and hospitalizations, and look at de Blasio's track record of being a broken record. Also refer to @alexandemeister—genius. If this forecast is wrong, my advice is... don't take my advice, I'm a load of poo. I wanted to forecast NO early on but decided not to. But nothing has substantially changed my analysis since then so I'm jumping into the fire right... NOW.

R_0 down to .94. De ballasio has been clear that his strategy is vaccine, and last thing new gov wants to do is mask mandate. 
https://covidestim.org/us/NY

Let’s start with other large cities and their current stance on mask mandates. I used https://worldpopulationreview.com/us-cities as a source for the largest cities. 
Looking at the 9 largest cities after NYC I look to see if they have a mask mandate that would satisfy this question as well as if they might have other mandates.  LA - Yes https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/22/us/la-county-mask-mandate.html Chicago, IL - Yes https://abc7chicago.com/chicago-face-masks-mask-mandate-chicaog/10963557/ Houston - No, but they do have one for city workers that might be struck down. https://apnews.com/article/health-texas-coronavirus-pandemic-houston-0ced378456550ba5b9bed791cb42d580
The school board also approved a mask mandate: https://www.texastribune.org/2021/08/11/texas-mask-mandates-covid-19/ Pheonix - No, but they do have one in city buildings. https://www.phoenix.gov/newsroom/em-and-hs/1917 Philly - Yesish, looks like they require masks inside businesses unless the business requires vaccinations. https://6abc.com/philly-covid-restrictions-pa-indoor-dining-coronavirus-philadelphia/10944795/ San Antonio, TX: No, but yes in schools. https://www.sanantoniomag.com/what-you-need-to-know-about-san-antonios-school-mask-mandate/. Again, this is in the courts due to TX’s ban on mask mandates.  San Diego: No https://www.kpbs.org/news/2021/jul/26/san-diego-county-will-not-reinstate-mask-mandates-/. Looks like masks are required for unvaccinated people. Also there is mandate for vaccines/masks for government employees.  Dallas - Yes: https://www.texastribune.org/2021/08/11/texas-mask-mandates-covid-19/
Again in the courts.  San Jose - Yes: https://sanjosespotlight.com/masks-will-be-required-indoors-in-santa-clara-county/ Full blown yeses are 4/9. Supposing there is a weight of 1/2 for cities that have other types of mandates (assuming they may implement full-blown mandates in the near future I get (4+4*(1/2)) = 6/9.  This gives a range of 44-67%.  Two competing effects are the rise of the Delta variant and that Mayor de Blasio said he wouldn’t issue a full blown mandate. https://apnews.com/article/lifestyle-business-health-coronavirus-pandemic-97863fa563eadaad177e0ccba8000cb4. Apparently he is serious about encouraging vaccinations over mask-mandates. However - seems like there is strong pressure to institute a mandate locally, as well as with the updated CDC guidance. So my hunch is to be at the upper end of the range above - say 63%-ish at this point. Worth keeping a close eye the developments until this resolves.

https://greekreporter.com/2021/08/03/new-york-city-face-masks-indoors/ The Mayor of America’s most populous city said that he is shying away from an official mask mandate in order to shift the focus on vaccinations.

R_0 is fading  and at 1. Hurricane is going to consume policynakeres for next week and by then cases could be rolling over.That plus the vaccine checks at restaurants makes me think an announcement in near term unlikely,  A long time until November though. https://covidestim.org/us/NY https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.nytimes.com/2021/08/03/nyregion/nyc-vaccine-mandate.amp.html

Hocus has said mask mandate likely for schools but still no discussion of retail

Guidelines are pretty strict in that any store can make their own mandate which must be followed but it is not forced on the store.
Cases are very high but may have peaked?
The discovery that fully vaccinated can transmit is important.

Coming up a bit as breakthrough infections are becoming more common. Still I think the city has a pretty clear policy to incentivize vaccinations as much as possible, and overlaying the mask mandate on top of that would derail that.

Chicago just announced mask mandate indoors for vaccinated individuals while currently having a lower # of daily covid cases than NYC (even per capita).  Don't see how they wouldn't follow especially by 1 November 2021.

Announced new vaccine mandate but still vary wary of mask mandate. I am moving down unless delta gets really crazy
https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/16/arts/design/nyc-museums-vaccine-required.html
Mandate achieving what they wanted with really high vaccination numbers

mayor seems reluctant to impose a mandate and provide a carrot to getting vaccinated, and adams (likely next mayor) seems to have a similar view.  Delta picking up but political will doesn't seem to be there, and NYC case counts so far are more muted vs. south and hospitlizations in check, along with delta potentially peaking in south currently
Increasing evidence of children getting delta and being hospitalized. Children unable to receive existing vaccines. Also, vaccine effectiveness appears to decline with time.
Kathy Hochul is much more open to masks and the Pfizer vaccine was recently shown to be less than 50% effective against the Delta Variant.
58% of the population fully vaccinated and there's a reluctance to go the mask route... but delta is really picking up.

Here in San Diego a few restaurants are requiring proof of vaccines. MIT is predicting a peak of over 300k cases a day by 10/1. the Trend is multiple layers as laid out in The Premonition. Vax plus mask plus distance is what I see for this winter. So NYC with high population density is likely to be the most regulated city in the US
The prevailing environmental and sociological conditions transition through the fall & will bring highlighting of Delta transmissibility in enclosed proximities.

I didn't really want to forecast on this one, it is such a guess.
Will keep an eye on case numbers, vaccinations and hospitalization.
https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2021/us/new-york-city-new-york-covid-cases.html
Reading all the justifications there is better evidence for no mask mandate but hard to know.

OK. A couple things.  1. NYC is clearly making the big push on vaccines as that is the single best way to save lives. Restaurants etc now require them. Don't want to fight a war on two fronts: https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/02/nyregion/covid-mask-mandate-ny.html 2.  Delta is ripping, but because infection has become so widespread we're starting to get less and less vulnerable population. Alabama reproductive number is turning over, NY won't be far behind: https://covidestim.org/us/AL 3. Hospitalization and mortality remain way way lower and anecdotally, ther eis some hesitancy to make rules that will have less impact. Masks already mandated in schools, mass transit, hospitals.  4. Restaurants as a location to require masks makes no sense since you definitionally have the mask off for much of the time. IT's more likely you close them than require masks. So retail is the question, but with NYC trying to re-open broadway it's hard to imagine they do that at the same time as they slap a mask mandate on stores, which are not super high risk.  5. Youre seeing a lot of self regulation on masks, taking pressure off of govt to make a mandate. As an example, broadway is requiring vaccines plus mask: https://www.broadway.com/buzz/201063/broadway-requires-covid-vaccines-and-masks-for-audiences/ So the question comes down to retail. Does govt want to mandate masks (when mandate might not be respected anyway) in a place where the risk is realtively low, when they have mandates in the higher risk places anyway and are making a full court press on vaccines.

With the data all pointing towards a cresting of the current wave in Fall. And given the rapid spread of the Delta variant (90% of cases now in US are Delta), and the next variant is right behind it.  Already breakthrough cases are exponentially increasing each week. And each new variant increases the odds of a variant that evades the vaccine, the two tools that work (along with the vaccine) is social distancing and masking. Even with the vacccine passport that NY has started, the CDC is highly likely to recommend states to go back to mask mandates to control the spread.
depends on course of Delta variant spread as well as if vaccination rates in New York City continue to climb

1) Cooler weather coming in Nov.
2) Possible mutation beyond Delta
3) Some 50+ NYC events coming up in Nov
We’re I am working is already mandatory. Is matter of time to extend this to states.

Some uncertainty if Hochul becomes a factor or if a new vaccine resistant variant becomes dominant in NYC but De Blasio is fully committed to vaccines over masks. Also masks at restaurants is a singularly stupid policy. You have to take the mask off to eat. Retail stores maybe. Other factors that might convince De Blasio to change direction or Albany to overrule Gracie Mansion include a post Labor Day spike above 5% positivity or 25 cases per 100,000 or a failure of the Key to NYC Pass program.
Rethinking: of course things are going to get bad in NYC.

Listening to his advisor, de Blasio is pushing for vaccination above all. But, he does say that nothing is off the table for the future.
Cuomo is also becoming more hands off, at least in this realm.
I suspect that unless cases get to 4k to 5k/day with a lot of hospitalizations, there won't be a mask mandate that meets the requirements of this forecast. I'm not sure how bad things will get in NYC and what other restrictions will be put in place.
2 million adults not vaccinated, half the people not wearing mask in crowded indoor places like Target, cases are bound to keep increasing in the city.

Yes, people will force the governor to implement new mandates,  he is after all supposed to be a servant of the people. Rallies towards this goal, has already started, I do believe it might be even sooner than November 2021.

Hedging a bit given the crowd’s near certainty on this and the fact that even places like Louisiana have mandates in place. That said, my understanding is that the mandates already cover the high spread places and that NYC is focusing on vaccines above all else given their relative efficacy in reducing severe cases.
Based on his previous public health decisions and his recent public updates about best practices, yes.

Tough to look at a base rate here. The main relevant cases seem to be California (yes mandate), and London (no mandate, except for public transit:  https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-europe-health-government-and-politics-coronavirus-pandemic-105efe9f913055d7b60cd2c1fd5e8adb). My guess is NYC probably goes with the “expects and recommends” but doesn’t require. Requiring masks in restaurants doesn’t make a lot of sense since most of the time in a restaurant you’re unmasked for the purpose of eating. Retail establishments aren’t the primary source of spread.  Data from the UK is suggesting that delta case growth will decelerate eventually, and importantly case growth is decoupling from mortality and strain on the hospital system. However it’s increasingly clear that vaccines don’t fully stop spread of delta, though they do losses severity massively.  Complicating things further, the CDC is recommending masking for vaccinated individuals in high transmission areas, which will apply to pretty much everywhere at some point between now and November.
I write this from San Francisco, where the indoor mask mandate (for both vaccinated and unvaccinated) was just reimposed two days ago (04AUG2021).

With nearly 3 months to go, I see this as almost certain although I am surprised it hasn't already been implemented. "The decision not to reissue an indoor mask mandate comes a week after the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention issued new guidance that fully vaccinated people should wear masks indoors when in areas of "substantial" or "high" Covid-19 transmission. All five boroughs in NYC are in areas of "substantial" or "high" transmission, a metric based on case rates and positivity rates." "The mayor's decision contrasts with that of Washington DC, Los Angeles County and some other large metro areas that have reissued mask mandates amid the spread of the Delta variant of Covid-19. Already, New York City requires vaccinated people to wear masks on public transit, in hospitals and in schools."  (https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/02/us/nyc-mask-mandate/index.html)

Cases in NYC seem relatively low and other measures such as proof of vaccination for indoor dining are being pushed over mask mandates. However the mayor has stated that "everything is on the table" and other major cities have imposed mask mandates for the vaccinated indoors. The probability would be lower but Delta poses a serious threat and will probably continue to plague the nation and NYC into the fall, at which point I see a good chance of mask mandates being reimposed.

Covid cases will continue to escalate in the short term because of delta. Pressure would mount for booster shots as more breakthrough cases climb. Mask mandate will be a stop gap reaction until cases go down.
